definition: to sneak in without a ticket/to stow away
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Berlin estimates it lost a record five million euros last year to fare dodgers.
sentences.chinese: 柏林估計它去年由於逃票人造成了五百萬英鎊的損失。

sentences.english: They jumped on a train and stole a ride.
sentences.chinese: 他們跳上一列火車，逃票搭乘。

definition: to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
(coll.) to ride in sb else's car to save money/to ride on a train or bus without buying a ticket (fare-dodging)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
